page.title: 04Weather and Climate
page.content: The climatic conditions of the area are influenced by its position, altitude and its proximity to the sea. The area is situated in {South_West {Wales}on the west windward side of Britain.It is exposed to the direct influence of South_Westerly winds which are both rain and heat bearing. The area is therefore,subject to rain in all seasons:its winters are generally mild and its summers warm.On average,the area enjoys a considerable ammount of sunshine in the summer months - around 6.2 hours every day!
